titles.title: Prescription Drug Marketing Reform Act of 1994
A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to prohibit the distribution of samples of prescription drugs.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6605)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

term.name: Department of Health and Human Services

bill.summary: 6/8/1994--Introduced. Prescription Drug Marketing Reform Act of 1994 - Amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to prohibit the distribution of prescription drug samples. Exempts from such prohibition any programs established by drug manufacturers or distributors for specifically identified patients in financial need. Imposes criminal penalties for violations of this Act.
